01/01/16 Called at 9:00am and made a reservation for 10:45am. Girl on the phone said it wasn't busy and took my name.  Arrived on time and there was no table available. When I asked her why not she said because they got busy and she wasn't watching the time to save us a table. Uhhhh, thanks hostess. Honestly, her attitude to accompany her F@&k-up didn't help either.   ORDERED: - Benedict florentine with cottage cheese - 1 waffle dog (gave me a stomach ache) - chicken with tomato - omelette with mushrooms and cheese - 3 coffees & 3 waters  PROS: - after the F&$k up the server was very nice. He came by frequently to ensure we had what we needed  - food came out fairly quickly.   CONS: - set a reservation and the hostess didn't follow through with it - had a snooty explanation. After my husband asked about it and the table wasn't ready I had to engage the hostess to see what was going to happen next. She was ready to take the next person instead of addressing our need for a table. So weird.  - the waffle dog wasn't that great. Don't have high expectations  - Coffee: goodness it sucked. Such bad coffee. Yuck! - Benedict: English muffin was pure mush. They forgot to toast it. Poached eggs were over cooked and yolk was solid

Love this breakfast place! Food is excellent and service by our favorite waiter Jeff is superior!! He goes above & beyond to make sure we have a good experience.  We come @ least once a month and enjoy each time
Good food, good experience.  Always is.  I love this place and Tempe is as good as Arcadia :)

Loved the fried chicken and waffle dish.  The spice and the maple syrup really worked well together.  My wife's chilaquiles dish was excellent, also, and she also enjoyed their signature iced coffee drink.  Nice vibe in this place, too.

Went here because it was a Food Network reviewed restaurant in Diners, Drive Ins and Dives. It was tasty but a few things were bummers. 1, it was busy. Food took a while to come out. I ordered Corn Beef and Hash Cakes with a hollandaise sauce. So, since our food took a while to come out, I fear that my food sat for a while and the texture I was expecting was a let down. It was more mush because the sauce overtook what I presumed the texture to be more of a hash cake. It was mushy and my food was almost colder than room temperature. It was weird. As if they don't have food warmers. It was tasty I'll give them that. But even my caramelized onions were mush which normally happens when caramelized onions have sat a while. So over all. 3 I think is satisfactory. Maybe if we would've came here on a less busy day the food woulda been great. My wife ordered a breakfast burrito. No mush there but there were no wet ingredients.

Well my first review of Over Easy; have gone here a few times; only reason I don't go more often probably because of the wait. The food is definately makes me want to return.  The Hopple Popple, the Wolf  Pack, and what I had today, the Loco Moko (only criticism is the rice); great lemonade (when I used to drink lemonade) and the hash browns & they have tater tots!!! I'll be back; when I can get up early...

The coffee was perfect. The service, commendable. I ordered the caramelized banana and pecan brioche French toast. The rubbery texture of the bananas was off-putting, the pecans were chopped way too small, and the caramel sauce was runny. The brioche was, however, delicious. I would visit again, but I would not order what I had this time round.
Dang, does this place know how to make a good breakfast. The Wolf Pack is aaaaaamazing! It gets busy on the weekends, so expect a wait... but it's definitely worth it!

We have always had the best breakfast food and the best service at this location.  Fast delivery with a smile, delicious eats, comfortable seating...This is our favorite weekend breakfast spot in Mesa!

Sign is upside down  . A little  difficult  to fund . I had their  corn beef hash . It was put in a small  plate  and kept  falling  of the plate . The hash was salty  and dry . I like the menu but the food  was average

New Location at the Altell Ice Den in North Scottsdale is now open, bigger space the the 40th spot... Food still great. Also 18 degress the lunch and dinner joint they own is open next to it as well. I have not eaten their yet! Menu looks good.

Great breakfast place !! Fast service and friendly. Be prepared for food coma. I had chicken fried steak with over easy eggs and sweet tots it was greatttt !! $10   Caramelized banana pecan french toast $5 Orange juice pricey $5 PER GLASS    I had wait about 5-10min to be served not bad!  We will be back to try more good food !!  :-)

Best food in Western US.  Best breakfast ever.  Best service.   I will not eat anywhere else when we are home. Eggs perfect. Pancakes perfect.  The best ever. Unusual but great dishes also available.  The best!!! I travel extensively  and know good food. This exceeds expectations.

I had high expectations walking in since we had seen this place on DDD/Food Network. It was average. We ordered the famous Waffle Dogs which was by far the best of what we ordered. My boyfriend ordered the Hash & Eggs with tater tots which he said was good. I ordered the Country Fried Steak & hash browns which was disappointing. The CFS was soggy/not crispy at all like you would expect and the hash browns were also soggy and oily so I didn't finish even half my breakfast. Too bad.

We LOVE Over Easy!!! Every Friday morning, our Date Day begins with Julian and his AMAZING staff!!! Food is always fresh and so Yummy!! They make their OWN English muffins and jelly!!!! The staff is extremely friendly, courteous and very helpful!   Looking for a good breakfast place? Over Easy is your place!!!

This place is the perfect brunch spot. I am a sucker for a great brunch. We got the chicken and waffles and the classic eggs Benedict! I loved  their signature iced coffee and the OJ was perfection I could've have a gallon of it. My only thing is that I wish the Benedict had more of that delicious hollandaise sauce it was a little stingy with the sauce.

I was pleasantly surprised to find out that they serve gluten free pancakes and sugar free syrup!  Overall the food is on par with most breakfast places. Ambiance very nice . Modern diner style booths and really cool decorations surround you. Best of all the service was quite good and the price for breakfast for two $28. I highly recommend this pretty cool place.
Love the new menu. Avocado benedict is awesome!!!! Peach bellini goes well with everything ;)

Not bad,  but not amazing either.  The Eggs Benedict Florentine had nicely blanched fresh spinach,  but something about the houlindese sauce is off.  Maybe the lemon or the lack of zing in the flavor.

Breakfast is easy. As far as restaurants are concerned, it's something that's very hard to screw up. Menu creation can't be all that difficult because of the classic meat + egg + potato + bread formula we've all come to expect. I'm not here to write to say Over Easy screwed up, but they were on the verge of coming close.  I had been wanting to try Over Easy for about a  year now, partly because of all the media attention is has received locally as well as nationally. I'm always up for an alternative to the national chain pancake houses I grew up eating at. For this reason and the classic breakfast formula being so hackneyed and often trite, I am often inclined to avoid that part of the men, unless [the restaurateurs] try something a little different with it.  Over Easy showed promise with a little dish they call "The Wolfpack".   Upon more objective observation, the dish is just a mild variation on an old classic with more starch, luring you into a false sense of hedonistic pleasure, but really just filling your belly with potato.  Being my first time here, and looking to enjoy a good hearty breakfast, I decided to play it relatively safe and ordered The Hopple Popple. Chunks of salami, potato, cheese and egg scrambled together with bell peppers for color and for texture and served with a side of toast. It's another variation on an old classic and probably not unlike something I'd make at home, so I decided to try it.  It's description reminded me of something I had ordered at Matt's Big Breakfast not too long ago, so why not.  My first thought as my server placed my plate in front of me was "That's it?" Presentation left something to be desired and even though the atmosphere had a somewhat kitschy greasy spoon vibe to it, I wasn't all that impressed. The amount of salami was substantial, but the chunks were so big, they appeared sparse in the monochromatic assembly of ingredients that lay before me. It may sound silly, but a small bit of parsley or a sprig of rosemary as garnish would have probably classed up the plate a little.  My wife tried the Chicken Fried Steak, an old classic I am always drawn to, especially at independents because it really gives them a chance to shine. Any old restaurant can take a flash frozen fritter and drop it in the deep fryer, but it really takes something to bread your own steak. For that I give Over Easy kudos.   For my daughter, the economic egg + potato + bread dish (add meat for $2 more) satisfied all nutritional requisites but was very basic in it's execution. The most interesting part of the whole meal was when the matriarch of the crew behind the counter shared with us their Tomato Jam, a salty sweet concoction that was equally good as a spread on toast as it was a dip for tater tots.    In all, I wasn't all that impressed, but the menu showed promise and perhaps next time I'll be a little more adventurous in my selection as long is isn't just thrown on the plate because going out isn't all about the food, it's the experience as well.

I love Over Easy Arcadia and was thrilled when they expanded to Gilbert and Mesa. This location definitely doesn't have the vibe the Phx and Gilbert locations have- totally different clientele- think Denny's. But there was no wait, the food came out fast, and was just as good as the others. My omelet was good and my toddler loved the french toast. For a quick and yummy breakfast we will definitely be coming here again.

We had such a great experience here this morning! The wait moved quickly, the hash browns and lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing, and the coffee was just what I needed after a night out. There was a slight mishap where my pancakes got sent to the wrong table and the staff and manager went above and beyond and even comped our breakfast! We will definitely be back for some yummy food and great service.

This is not the store that Guy likes so much on DDD but a companion. Parking is often an issue. Staff is nice, helpful, etc, and they are attentive to the customers. I suppose part of that is to keep us moving. There is usually a wait.  The food is plentiful. I had the chicken fried steak first time and it was good, not great. Second time was bacon and eggs and hash browns.  Good, not great. Friends had other breakfast choices and were happy. None of us tried the wolf pack which is large and enormous portions. The other day we tried another place for breakfast and decided we need to go back here.

I usually like this place but was a little disappointed this last time. I tried the eggs Benedict and did not like their own made hollandaise sauce. Next time I'm sticking with my usual blueberry pancakes. Boyfriend liked his meal (he had the wolf pack). Service was good. We got in quickly for a busy Memorial Day Monday morning. Unfortunately we both got sick later in the day and it was the only meal we had eaten so I'm going to be a little hesitant next time I think about going to over easy.

Great breakfast joint!  I've eaten there twice and have recommended it to a few friends, and all have loved it.  The Hopple Popple is my favorite, and the portions are huge!  Not the greasy spoon that you often see when dining out for breakfast.
The breakfast burrito was okay and for this reason I felt it was overpriced. The location next to Ice Den and the operating hours are really great. The staff are friendly and the service was fast.

I had a Dr. appointment early in the morning and I had to travel to downtown Phoenix. Afterwards, it was still pretty early, so I decided to try Over Easy. I saw this place on Diner's, Drive-In's and Dive's, but I didn't realize I was close by, until I saw it on my Yelp app (for Android-which isn't as good as the iPhone app-BOOO!). I popped in and had the (I don't remember what it's called), it was the Mexican one. It had strips of tortilla's and a sauce with an egg on top. The sauce was really good, but the entire dish was, overall, just average. It was the dish the server recommended, too.   I'll probably stop by again if I'm in the area. This time, I'm having the Eggs Benedict. Person next to me had it, and it looked AMAZING!

My girls from work and I had a rough night so we decided to visit a breakfast place that serves alcohol and at the same time, close to our workplace. Over easy was the best option so we went and had a good time. The service was really good and we were seated rather quickly. The guy that served us was kind, suggested a few things. I got the avocado toast and Bellini. It was a great combo however, I found the toast to be slightly overpriced. Overall, we had a good time. I want to come back and try something different!

Completely disappointed and feeling ripped off.  I'm not a hog but when I buy breakfast I expect to be full when I leave.   I ordered the corned beef hash breakfast that was comprised of about 3/4 of a cup of CBH, two eggs, and 2 pieces of toast.  The CBH was borderline gross so I guess  they did me a favor with the bird like portion.  Just shy of 14$ before tipping the pleasant Hispanic waitress 5$.  NEVER AGAIN, hate getting ripped off....

I had a perfect breakfast here.   First, I sat out on the patio, and al fresco is always a bonus. My mushroom omelette was outstanding, with just the right quantity of flavorful brown mushrooms. So many mushroom omelettes are made with small bits of bland white mushroom that the whole thing seems sort of beside the point. I also had goat cheese in the thing and, damn, that tasted mighty fine.  Another bonus: Espresso tasted like it should, with complex flavor and zero bitterness. This is not easy to do, at least as judged by the dozens of places around the western U.S. I've tried the stuff, of which very few get it right.  Service and serving was prompt. The place is clean and comfortable and, for the high quality of the food and espresso, better prices than I expected. Will definitely be back!

Still a good to great breakfast joint for us.  We've been back a couple of times in the last few months to try some different menu items.  In September I had the bacon, egg, & cheese English muffin sandwich with home fries ($8) and my husband had the chicken fried steak & hash browns ($11).   I was asked how I'd like my egg, and I ordered it over easy.  When the sandwich came out, the yolk was cooked hard.  Now for me, breakfast is no fun unless there's delicious yolk running everywhere.  So I mentioned it to our server and she took the plate back to the kitchen.  It came back with half as many home fries and an over easy egg, but the English muffin wasn't toasted and the cheese was kinda cold.  Lesson learned.  I'll follow my mom's advice and just shut up and eat what I was given the first time.  I love the home fries.  They get them golden crispy and grill them up with onions.  Perfection.  My husband enjoyed his chicken fried steak and we planned to come back again soon.    This month we had the breakfast burger ($11) and the wolfpack ($9), and just went halvsies on everything.  The breakfast burger tasted like a pressed, previously frozen patty, but with an over easy egg on it, some onion straws, and cheese, it held up reasonably well on flavor.   The wolfpack is always delicious.  We sit at the bar and the service has always been friendly and efficient.  Solid 4/5 for us.

This place is excellent for a weekend brunch. I suggest going early to beat the crowd AND the heat. I would suggest the waffles and I don't normally even like waffles. There is some sort of secret recipe in these puppies, they are light and melt in your mouth. The best thing you can do is custom order the bananas foster (on menu with pancakes) but have it with your waffle instead. Unbeatable. You'll get service with a smile, great quality food and low prices. If you can sit inside and watch the proceedings in the kitchen, you'll see the place running like a well-oiled machine.

Went here today with my coworkers on a work trip and had one of the worst and most mediocre chicken omelets I've had. The fruit consisted of a piece of pineapple, piece of melon and unripe grapes. Our waitress was nice, but the food was bad.

Little breakfast spot along the outter part of superstition springs mall. My family said they had a creative menu and being a person who loves to check out places that were different, this was a must.  We were greeted by hostess who was welcoming and very smiley. Seated fairly quickly and greeted by our server within a minute of sitting down. Service overall was pretty good, only complaint was we noticed 2 tables that were sat after us got their food before us. Granted we did have a larger party but one of the parties was also a bigger party so kinda made a few people at our table urked when they noticed that.   As for food, I agree the menu was creative. I got the avocado benedict. Healthy option for eggs Benedict, instead of an English muffin they use avocado. The pico serves inside definitely adds flavor. I would get it again. Wolfpack is confusing, they have eggs and bacon topped with a mass amount of hash browns. You gotta search underneath for the eggs and meat.
I was a little disappointed with both the service and the food.  The food was not even warm when it was served.  It was greasy on top of that.  Coffee was good though.

I came back a 2nd time and brought a different friend with us.  We still came on a Saturday at around 11 am and while it was busy, we got seated right away.  I went big and got the Wolfpack Club which is the original Wolfpack but more bacon, an extra layer of hash browns and 2 more eggs.  The price of this bad boy was $16.50.  The original Wolfpack sells for $8.99 (I believe).  I was full but was it worth the money?  Kind of.  Instead of cheese it was topped it with I'd rather have the country sausage gravy on it instead.  So for $16.50, I'm going to get the Wolfpack (PlanetCabo style).  I will get the Wolfpack minus the cheese and get an order of biscuits and gravy and marry the 2 together. BAM!  A star is born.  One of these days I will try their brioche french toast but my new concoction is calling me first.
I like scrambled eggs.  This means not making an omelette and at the last minute mucking it up to make it look like scrambled eggs.  This makes it taste like a fried egg to me.  Took forever as well.

My wife and I wanted to have a nice Sunday breakfast and head to Over Easy in North Scottsdale.   There was a 20 minute wait which we expected, but the waitress sat us down inside about ten minutes in.   The waitress we had was very nice. I know we've had her before, but I'm blanking on her name. Anyway, I got the Wolfpack, which is a favorite of mine. My wife got an omelete. I felt like being a pig so I ordered one Waffle Dog.   When the food came, I got a whole plate of them. This was a mistake, but this was taken care of by the restaurant. They only charged me for the one and were very apologetic about the mistake.   I offered the waitress one but she declined. I only wanted one! They're good!   My wife got their ice coffee which I took a sip of and did not like. I don't think the cardamom inside it agreed with me.  I like this location much better than the 40th street and Indian School one. The people here are more friendly and the food taste better here for some reason.

When I saw they were putting another Over Easy in Phoenix, I was ecstatic. The other location on Indian School is usually pretty packed, so I hadn't had a chance to try this place out. Imagine my surprise when, late on a Sunday morning, the restaurant was relatively empty. Odd...  I was in the mood for chicken and waffles, so I didn't have to spend too much time agonizing over the menu. It was a decent meal, but it failed to live up to the "Best Food Ever" hype (which is stated in the menu, btw). They don't really garnish it any special way, and it's a little pricey considering you get just one breast and one waffle.You can easily get two or three more pieces of chicken at other breakfast joints of similar caliber.  I think my biggest complaint though was the service. They specifically highlight their "Midwestern hospitality" on their website, but I didn't get that vibe at all. My waitress was cold and only said as much as she needed to in order to do her job. She brought the check halfway through the meal without even asking how the food was, which made me feel a bit rushed and unwelcome. Not enough to ruin my day, but still a bummer coming from a place featured on the Food Network.  I'll probably come back here again and give it another go, but before then, I'll definitely continue to broaden my brunch horizons.
Nice portions and friendly service. Good experience but I enjoy other places in the valley for a good breakfast.
I agree, this place doesn't have anything special to offer and seating is crammed. Service wasn't too bad but their is room for improvement.

We had just arrived in the Phoenix area after a long drive and what an unexpected treat! The servers are so kind and go out of their way to make sure you are enjoying your meal and experience. We both ordered the chicken fried steak breakfasts and it was the best we've ever ordered. So flavorful and crispy, we will definitely be stopping by again before we leave Arizona. Thanks for the wonderful meal!

Fantastic food, prompt, friendly service and a cool atmosphere.  The staff was very friendly and our or orders came out so fast I couldn't believe it!  I ordered the crying pig omelet  with hash browns and a bloody mary, absolutely fantastic.  The covered patio looks inviting when the weather cools off.  They also had a carry out option, which we may take advantage of at some point.  I will definitely go back!

I used to visit the old location, before they moved. It was fun, had character and, of course, delicious food.  I hadn't visited this new location yet and was looking forward to our visit.  Unfortunately, it was nothing special.    The food was good, but not great.  A little overpriced and dishes were on the small side.  The ambiance was so-so.  About what you'd expect for a restaurant in a strip mall.  Service was fine.  Nothing really went wrong, but it just wasn't that special.  It wasn't the same restaurant as the one I visited at its previous home, and that's too bad.

Food was not good!  I wish I had read some of the reviews before taking my friends there.  We went in for breakfast with 2 other couples based on Guy Fieri's review.  Each of us ordered something different and were very disappointed. The eggs were extra small and over cooked, hash browns were mushy, omelets were burnt on the edges, ham steak was tough and the red eye gravy was about one teaspoonful on the plate. The corned beef hash wasn't any better than Libby's out of the can.  We don't plan to eat here again.  I guess when you know Guy Fieri is coming in you make the food look better and probably taste better. Too bad!

I love finding good breakfast places. Places that are not your ordinary breakfast place. Good and different breakfasts at a good price. I had the Avocado Benedict, which was absolutely perfect especially if you are not a carb lover, you don't even know if you are missing them. I also had the Lemon Ricotta pancakes and they were light and fluffy and very lemony, so if you like lemons you will love these. The place is casual and has a retro diner feel. Slightly cramped but the food makes it worth it. It was very good.

The food was great.  The service was fantastic. Lonnie, our server, was quick, and personable. He geeked out with us over various things throughout our meal. I had the country fried steak. My wife had the cheddar jalapeño biscuits and gravy.  We're definitely coming back.

Wow, such a letdown. We tried to come here on a weekend morning and the place was packed with a line out door - usually a sign of something good. I stopped in on a week day afternoon and the girl with blue hair looked puzzled or annoyed that I was there. Luckily she turned out to be my waiter - oh so lucky... I wasn't in the mood for just two eggs and bacon as 90% of the menu was comprised of just that so I ordered the chiquiles. It was described to have tortillas but they meant tortilla chips which I guess is another way to prepare this dish. It was a bland sauce poured over soggy tortilla chips with chicken bits hidden underneath and two eggs on top. Horrible but I guess that's my mistake for ordering something I'm not familiar with but I would've appreciated a kick to it. Luckily the blue haired girl noticed my drink was empty but that was all I saw of her other than to drop my check off which is bad because I was her only table. I won't be back.

This is my new favorite breakfast place, and my twins not only behaved but they ate very well.  It was awesome to see them eat almost all their food.  I shared 1/2 a portion of the caramelized bananas and pecans brioche french toast with the hubby and had the egg whites asparagus omelet with home fries.  My hubby like my home fries better than his hash browns.  I am sure we will be back soon, there is so much we want to try.

This place is one of the worst places I've been to we sat at the bar for over 30 minuets and when we told the server we were ready she said I'm not ready I have to serve this other customer.....and then she continued to ignore us. This place should get new servers or just shut the doors if their not in it for customer service....

Stopped in for breakfast this morning. The fresh squeezed orange juice was amazing. Food was ok and the service was average. Waited at least 15 minutes to get our check when we were done as the waitress was too busy chatting up a man dining alone at the bar.

New to town and was thrilled with the menu selections. Bright casual atmosphere. A bit noisy. Great coffee and very friendly staff initially. Today was apparently an anomaly as a shortage in the kitchen meant over an hour wait for food and our server disappeared after taking our order- leaving us to fend for ourselves.Many upset customers  Wouldve been nice for them to inform us of kitchen issue. Not sure if we will try again.

I will no longer visit this location, as I am so spoiled by the phoenix staff, food, and overall experience that I cannot subject myself to this location ever again. I have given it three chances to win me over, but on all occasions there have been issues with the visit. I am unsure if it is due to being in Gilbert, which does not scream standards, unless of course your measuring stick is being married with three kids, but something is consistently wrong, so I must bid this location adieu.   Food quality & Consistency is sub par.  Staff is unfriendly, and twice has tried to hustle our party out by bringing the check prior to it being asked for and without our food being finished from our plates.   No refills offered, which is weird given that I believed it customary to at least ask once the level of liquid in a cup reaches a certain level.     Check came out with the wrong charges even after I corrected the server (not a big deal, but come on)  Hostess seated us behind a swinging door to the patio even with multiple other tables being an option; Although, Some were dirty (clean them! It's pretty standard to do so when customers leave)  I hate to rip an establishment I love, but this place has missed the mark entirely. I feel the expansion and popularity of Over Easy has killed what I once loved about the business.

The go to spot for a great breakfast served by even better people!  Even after the move the plate I order is delish and made to order per usual. Try the chicken fried steak and Hash-browns (ask for crispy) also order an extra side of gravy! Its packed with meaty goodness. For those who are not pleased with the food, people or atmosphere I'd like to know where else they can go and be greeted by the owners, have your order remembered and leave with a large to go coffee for free?   PS. Sweet Potato Tator Tots!!!! Heck yes they got em
I haven't had anything here that I didn't like, staff is very friendly, and I love the atmosphere. By far my favorite local breakfast spot.

Probably the best, no drama breakfast you'll get nesr Paradise Valley.  Great little patio area that's dog friendly and there's nothing like a brand new modern take on breafast and lunch bistro.  Best menu item for me is the Wolf Pack Over Easy, but definitely try the Eggs Benedict or a great omelette!

Nice build-out.  The eggs benedict was rather bland.    There are a lot of new breakfast places in the area.   Over Easy is one of them. Overall, it reminds me of North TX...it's just a little bit south of OK.

Had breakfast here one morning because of the recommendation of the place on Fieri's show.  My friend had the french toast and I ordered the chicken fried steak.  The chicken fried steak was good but nothing out of the ordinary.  It was a bit salty for my taste though.  The food item to brag about is the sausage.  We split the sausages that were coated with waffle batter.  Now those were interesting.  However, I felt that the sausages all by itself was the best.  Portions were generous and I would definitely like to try this place again just for the sausages.

Decided to give this one a second chance at their new location. Much better then the last time.  There were three of us this trip our order consisted of:  Traditional Eggs Benedict English muffin topped with ham  Loco Moko - a Hamburger patty on top of white rice, covered with brown mushroom gravy, topped with 2 eggs any style and crispy fried onions. - a Hawaiian favorite!   Chicken fried steak with country gravy, egg* & choice of potato  The food was hot, fresh and tasted good.

So I really wanted to like this place.. it's cute, super-packed, and had some good looking and original menu items.   It was just too busy and service was not as good as I hoped. I didn't get a coffee refill until I asked for the check.   I ordered the Wolf Pack, which is two eggs sandwhiched between hashbrowns with bacon and cheese.  My hashbrowns were a little undercooked, and I really don't like soggy hashbrowns. Other than that, it was delicious though.   My friend ordered the brioched french toast. When she asked our waitress what 'brioched' meant, the waitress told us it was just normal french toast... that really did not impress me. My friend said it was absolutely delicious though, some of the best french toast she's ever had.   I'll try this place again, since it's so close to home,  and its possible I just visited on an off day.  It's a tad dissapointing after visiting valley greats like Matt's Big Breakfast. Over-easy could be Arcadia's version of Matt's, with some work.   Plan on waiting for at least 15-20 minutes, as this place is PACKED. I went there at 8:30 on a Saturday morning and it was totally full and there was already a wait!

This really is as good as it gets for Bkfst outside your home here in Phx. LOVE their blueberry pancakes and of course the wolfpack (hash browns, eggs, bacon, cheese) so filling! Great service this morning.   Looks like the menu has expanded since my last visit which was ages ago. Will be back soon.

First time at Over Easy. Arrived at 7 on a Thursday morning and was the only customer. In this area, the retirees (there's a lot around here) sleep in. It was bright egg-yolk yellow inside and out, with a big Diner formica Counter.   I ordered the Corned Beef Benedict with Hash Browns and water. It came to $12.43 plus tip. As I ate, 2 more folks arrived.   My breakfast arrived in 12 mins, a bit slow for the only customer. My Benedict was ample in size and laced with grilled white onions. I love onions but the dish was 50% onion, so I could barely taste the beef. Good idea, poor execution. The hash browns were a course grate and crunchy, just right. The hollandaise was spot on.   The service was fine, with a good amount of attention whilst he set up the front of the restaurant. The kitchen crew was pretty loud tho, and due to the silent tv's, was distracting.   I'll try Over Easy again but opt for a different menu item.
We love the service and food. The staff is always friendly. Daniela always takes care of us and remembers us by name!!! It's our favorite breakfast place.

So here's a rundown.  Little Niece LOVED her M&M's pancakes.  Big Niece ordered the basic 2 egg, bacon, hash browns and toast and was a happy little camper with it.  One brother loved his Wolfpack and who wouldn't?  2 eggs, bacon & cheese sandwiched within two crispy layers of hash browns.  Yum!  The other brother thought the chicken fried steak was just okay.  The girls' mother liked her country benedict with a sausage patty, eggs and hollandaise sauce but didn't realize it was on a cheddar jalapeno biscuit.  That part wasn't her favorite.  As for me, I didn't care for the corned beef hash especially the texture.  Luckily I had also ordered a half order of the caramelized banana and pecan French toast.  Heavenly.  Plus I always love restaurants that allow half orders of French toast because then I can have a savory entree with a "dessert" without feeling like a pig for ordering two entrees.   And we all had to have the waffle dogs.  Its all the Food Network's fault.  And we are thankful to them for it.  It was delicious especially with the "waffle dog" sauce the servers set up - pancake syrup with hot sauce.

This place was packed and very loud. The food was good and ample. Everyone had leftovers. The chillaquilles had diced chicken and packed a little spicy kick, it easily was enough for 3 meals. The omelets were fluffy and fresh. My mom said the cheddar jalapeño biscuits were good although when I tasted hers it seemed dry. Loved their jelly options of mango or raspberry. Service was decent. We might come back but will  probably choose other breakfast restaurants that aren't so loud that it makes conversation impossible rather than this location.

Stopped in for breakfast while in the area.  Excellent food, service and clean. I had the Chicken Fried Steak with hash browns and two eggs. Everything on the plate was excellent. My only complaint was with me. I spilled gravy on my shirt and my shirt did not appreciate it as much as my taste buds.

Amazing!!! Such a funky, cool place. My food was amazing I got chicken and waffles and sweet potato tots!!! Mimosas were great and large potions of food. Taste like home!!! I will be going back for sure!!! Come early fills up quick!!! And they sure can cook a damn good egg!!!

2 words, Moko Loko. I found myself driving around and waiting in Gilbert (its a work thing). I saw Over Easy, pulled in, called co-workers and told them to meet me there. I have been to several other Over Easys and as of yet, no bad meals or experiences. This time was no different, I ordered the Moko Loko for the first time, it was really good. I even took a picture of it to send to a Samoan friend, to gloat. I'm paying for it now, my body wants to take a nap very badly. I also cannot forget to mention the OJ, so, so good. Anyway, if you are near any of the OE looking for breakfast, do not hesitate.

The restaurant is bright and clean, the food is good and the staff is very friendly. What a great way to start your day!  We started with the iced coffee, a strawberry rosemary lemonade and a Sprite. My sons sprite had a bug in it but they were great about replacing it without making a fuss. My husband loved his copy and I found the lemonade to decent but not overwhelming flavorful. The food on the other hand was great, I had the waffle dogs which were fabulous little sausages covered in pancake batter. Savory and sweet deliciousness! My husband had the banana nut French toast which he he loved and my son ordered the Cubano breakfast sandwich which was HUGE! The flavors in it were all great but it is beyond messy to try and eat with your hands so he finally gave up and went at it with his fork and knife.  We can't wait to go back and try some other items on the menu.

honestly i wasnt that impressed. The  chicken fried steak was featured on diners driveins and dives? ive had much better back in Mn at the windmill cafe my local greasy spoon. Honestly i wouldn't go back

Actually, pretty good! I ordered the "Hopple Popple" which is a mix of ham, onions, peppers and eggs mixed up with eggs scrambled and all is put on the grill. The only thing I would have loved to put it over the top is some good ol' Cheddar Cheese because it needed seasoning and that salty cheddar would have been great. I would have also added in Jalapeños for some spice instead of dripping on Cholula.  Lots of other "different" menu items to choose from so be prepared to read.  As a suggestion to moment who might read the review involved in Over  Easy operations a cole suggestions are turn the music down a little. With the hard floors and open area it's difficult to carry on a conversation. The menu would be much better served with photos of e menu items so people can decide easier what they want or may want to add to a dish. Visuals go a long ways.

Thought this would alot better than it was.  Was pretty much a lackluster breakfast with an over $30 price tag and a long wait.  We did order a Papago Orange Blossom beer to be fair but that was the best part of the whole meal.  Our waitress was a doll though, very sweet girl.  Overall:  Doesn't live up to the hype.
wolfpack! salted caramelized brioche french toast with toasted walnuts! awesome! great staff extremely helpful! we will be back!
Very disappointing!  Service was poor, at best. Server did not come to take order for 10 minutes!  Food quality was poor! Example: Avocado toast, stale bread, watery heavily salted avocado!

Walked into the restaurant at 8 am on a Sunday.  No one at the hostess stand; not even any greeting from the servers.  Finally a server came up and gave us menus and told us to seat ourselves.  If that is the usual, at least have a sign stating such.  When seated, Jamie asked if we wanted anything to drink.  We ordered two coffees and a bloody mary.  The coffee came, and there were flecks of something in the coffee...coating the side of the cup.  Not knowing what they were, we asked Jamie to bring us new cups of coffee.  No apology or explanation, she eventually brought two more cups of coffee.  One of them still had flecks of something in them.  At that point my partner just told her to take the coffee away and not to bring another.  The coffee that I received was ok, but there was never a refill.   For a breakfast place, I would think that coffee would be the first priority.  During the entire time that we ate breakfast and when Jamie took away the dishes, there was not ever the any coffee refills.  The breakfast was ok, but they should get the basics down first!
Went here while we were staying in Arizona. Food was awesome and our waiter Corey was boss as hell. Would definitely go here again.

If you are not here by 9 am or so, expect a wait. Even the call ahead for a large group was futile. We still had to wait 30 minutes. Definitely try the Wolfpack if you are watching your figure, Your figure expand!! This thing is awesome! The brioche french toast is delish as is the Hopple Popple and the Over Easy...i think that is what it is called with brioche, spinach and poached egg. Sometimes things come out in pieces like sides first, then entrees or vice versa. Patio seating nice too.

Came here hoping to support local business which I did by dining. The food is mediocre I would like in it to the taste of International House of Pancakes the service is subpar and definitely need some better training I was not completely disappointed with my visit as it was not the worst food that I've ever had. I do recommend many other restaurants in the Gilbert area for breakfast with better flavor and better service not a complete fail but certainly close to it

OK but not great.  Chicken and waffles dish had a tough piece of chicken deep fried in what must have been several days old grease.  It was terrible.  The maple syrup was so watery - a give away that suggested it was some cheap liquid soap-like stand in from Cisco or worse, Costco.  Go someplace else - go anywhere else.

As many others, I came seeking the famed Caramelized banana and pecan brioche French toast. When I saw it on the Food Network show, it looked amazingly delicious!!   When I saw it on my plate, it resembled something that came out of a sick babys diaper.  The caramel sauce both smelled and tasted burned, it seemed that the bananas were cooked in with the sauce, but the pecans did seem to be in bite size pieces.  My mother opted for the Chilaquiles- a mixture of tortillas, ranchero sauce chicken, sour cream &cheese served with 1 egg..any style***** Pure Deliciousness!!!!!!!!!! I sent back my mess of a plate for a half plate of plain ol' french toast and proceeded to take over her food!  If you go, get the Chilaquiles!!!!  You will not be disappointed!! Steer clear of the banana pecan french toast!!

VERY good service here even if you come during the busiest hours! I forgot the name of the gal that was helping us but she made sure to constantly check in on us, refill our water, ask us how our food was, and even made the best recommendation!  FOOD: Chicken and waffles - the waffles are a bit on the softer side and not so much crisp. But the chicken really made up for it. I really enjoyed the breading and even though it was white meat, I still enjoyed it! Don't forget to ask for a side of hash browns!  Banana nut french toast - this dish was OK. I felt like the french toast did not have the best consistentcy - it was not thick and did not hold shape very well. It sort of tasted like it may have been sitting out for a bit. The nuts on it were cracked and sprinkled over, unlike what i saw on the show "Diners, Drive-in's and Dives!  DRINK: Strawberry lemonade - it was just OK. A little watery and not enough lemonade in it - wish it was a little more tart!  SERVICE: This makes up for everything! Service here is the best - doesn't matter what time you come! Staff is friendly and attentive.

You can tell the ingredients are fresh. I ordered the Chicken and waffles and while the chicken was definitely not process or frozen, it was pretty bland. Even with the syrup, I felt like chicken could have used a little bit more pizazz. I did appreciate the freshness. I'm from Georgia so I take my fried chicken seriously.   The GM is great and very friendly. You can tell he is very involved in the operation of this place. Also, his beard is probably the most majestic thing I've ever seen. Seriously. It's beautiful.   The bus boy(man?) was a little too eager to take our plates. I had barely set my utensils down and he snatched it up. While we were waiting for our food, he kept coming around and picking up our straw wrappers and whatever little bits of trash on the table. Thanks for keep my area clean but please wait or ask if you can take any trash or plates. I felt a little rushed out considering it took 30mins for our food.   Overall, I'd come back. Mostly to get another glance at that beard.

I stare at the menu of so many great options and just can't get past the Thanksgiving Waffle!  It's a perfect, one-stop shop of a breakfast.   They cook the stuffing herbs into the waffle, load up layers of turkey slices, gravy and cranberry sauce for a savory sweet experience.  Cute diner atmosphere.  Friendly service.  Lots of regulars...

The banana pecan french toast was great - order a 1/2 order and split it with someone else for "breakfast desert"!  Rest of the food was definitely better than ok, but dropped my review to 3 stars because restrooms weren't clean and had no hand soap -- where are employees washing their hands???

The first time I went here the place was crowded, the wait was long, and it was hot as balls outside where we had to wait.  But boy was it worth it.  Chicken fried steak for breakfast? Yes please. Great coffee too. We'll be back.

I was very underwhelmed by this place, especially in light of all the breakfast competition in the immediate surrounding area. The food was ok, the service subpar. The decor was intended to mimic a 50s diner, but in place of the warmness you might expect from such an effort, it felt rather cold, inauthentic, plastic, industrial. Not the worst restaurant experience, but not quite satisfactory enough to warrant a second visit.

We were so excited to have breakfast at Over Easy. Unfortunately, our anticipation quickly waned. I ordered the Chicken and Waffles. (Which was featured on tv Best Things Ever Ate" per their menu. The waffle was "meh" but after cutting into the boneless breaded chicken...the meat was a greenish-gray and looked "old" ... Took another cut to see the same inside. See attached photo! The polite server returned at the end of our meal. He saw I had not eaten it, he asked if it was okay. I reported to him the off color meat. He apologized but did zero to inform the manager. We will not be back. The service was a four star the overall food a 1. Two stars was generous.
Best breakfast in the valley. The one downside is long long wait times, but the food is worth it! Friendly servers as well.

The thing with breakfast places is that most of them are offering many of the same menu items (and let's face it, eggs and toast are not that difficult to make well), so the way for them to stand out is with interesting combinations, lower prices, exceptional atmosphere, and great service.  As far as I can tell, Over Easy has none of these.  The first room kind of has a cool unfinished look with a nice counter.  Unfortunately, I was seated in the other room, which is carpeted (eww) and has a tv.  I felt like I was in the kids room or something.    The menu is nothing special and also not a bargain.  Most of the combos came with meat so I asked if I could substitute something else instead.  The waitress said I could get fruit, and I took her up on that.  When the bill came I saw that sure enough, she charged me extra for the fruit.    In summary:  Meh.  I've experienced better.
Waffle Dogs are out of this world. Will dine here as often as we are in Phoenix

Came here & was seated at the counter which was actually really nice, the counter was plenty spacious vs some others where you feel like you're rubbing elbows with the people next to you. I had the chicken & waffles which were some of the best I've had. The batter was light & crispy, it didn't fall off which is a total score in my book. The waffle had the perfect amount of sweetness to go with the salty crispy chicken. Delish! My husband tried their chamomile tea which was actual tea leaves vs bagged tea. We will definitely be back

After a long search for a great brunch location that also serves breakfast alcohol and is delicious, I finally found Over Easy!  My first encounter here gave me a delicious mimosa, and the Wild Pack (eggs over a heaping plate of hash browns and cheese, with bacon) and it was amazing.  Not to mention the few bites I was allowed to have from my husband's chicken and waffles (I almost asked to change my order, because of those bites).  Oh, and the service was on point!   Since then, I've been back several times, with my mom, cousin, brother, friends, and it's just as good every time!  I highly recommend the chicken and waffles, and the breakfast sandwich.   And did I mention that they squeeze their orange juice in house?  It's amazing!

Not very good.  Service wasn't very good. Waitress wasn't that friendly.  Pancakes were terrible, hashbrowns had no taste to them and a large OJ was $6!! WHAT THE?! My husband got the chiliqilas (sp?) and they were really good! I wouldn't go here again.

Been here before and thought it was ok-good. Saw the piece on Diners drive ins and dives and wanted to try it again. The place was packed, and I had to wait for a table, but after 10 min or so got a nice one inside with a view of the kitchen. I order ed the chicken fried steak, my friend had the wolf pack. The food took about 15 minutes, but came out hot and looked great. My chicken fried steak was one of the best Ive ever had. the hash browns were great too. Not to salty, but perfectly crisp. Speaking of hash browns, the wolf pack was loaded down with them. very good, but I was glad I stuck with the chicken. Staff was friendly and the place is cool. ill be back for sure.

okay, so it took me a while to get to this place. it's normally always closed when im in the area, but finally my seester & i made it! the place is located in an old Taco Bell bulding (the retro type) so you can totally enjoy the outside patio without much outside interference. we arrived just before the last hour was up, so we got seated right away. unfortunately the momentum of the servers was already exhausted, because it took about 45 minutes for our breakfast, and it took about half that time to place our order. there wasn't ever anyone around, except for the bussers (who didn't speak a lick'o english-or so they pretended) we even overheard two other tables complaining about not being approached for drinks or the initial order for 20 minutes, and we couldn't help but laugh at how long they would be there after placing their order!  the food was deo, but my sister had to go hunt down syrup for her stack. i noticed the bar a little too late, next time we will sit there. it looked as though those servers inside knew what they were doing.   i asked for coffee with a lot of cream, got the coffee with room for only 1 creamer, no cream and i had to get into a spanish convo with the busser because she didn't understand CREAM, totally forgot to ad the "A" and say "CREAMA" my bad.   i must say that the prices are good, the food looked and tasted good (after it finally arrived) just don't expect to have a server, you'll have to bring in your own condiments and fetch your own coffee. dang they must have had a "phat breakfast" (received lotso' tips) that day....because by the time we arrived, they had all quit for the day. it was a totall out of body experience for them, I'm sure, because i seen people wearing the uniforms. if you go visit this place make sure you arrive just as the crowd is winding down, not much later, or you'll have to don your apron.  UPDATE- just found out Aaron May owns this restaurant; funny thing is at his other place they are outstanding when it comes to customer service.

Look.  I don't know about Brad or the Taco Bell spot or whatever...  this place has about 20 tables, does really great breakfast and had decent (if they sometimes need reminding) service.  Honestly, for $30 for 2... it's awesome.  Had a sausage / bacon / cheddar omelet which was amazing and just what I wanted.  They have these lemon ricotta pancakes which were awesome and they generally do a great job of basics plus some really cool breakfasty enhancements.   Cool place for families where they turn the tables fast, keep the coffee filled and basically do whatever they can to be somewhere between diner and pretentious brunch (can you hear me Matt's Big Breakfast?).  Love this place and will come back over and over and over and over.

I have never experienced such a rude staff! First, the wait was pretty long on the Sunday morning we visited this restaurant, as to be expected, so my sister decided to grab some coffee as we waited. When she asked a server if the restaurant could make caffe latte's, she was told she should go to Starbucks for those things. Interesting response. I then asked if we could add an additional chair to our table of five, and they looked at me as if I should leave because that might be too much work. I ended up finding my own chair when nobody was willing to help me. Last, to top things off, we actually watched the manager of the restaurant ask two women sitting at a table next to us to leave because he had people waiting outside to eat! They hadn't even finished their meals!! I will never return to such poor service and overrated food.

Pretty disappointing. Took forever to get a simple egg, hashbrown and toast breakfast.  Toast was cold , didnt even melt the butter , the rest of the food was semi warm. For a 25.00 breakfast it wasnt worth it.

I liked this place.  The ambiance is very industrial.  The location is good.  The service was very good.  The mint lemonade is over priced and just okay.  (No free refills for $3.25).  The waffle dog was just okay.  The sausage was good but it just tasted like a pancake or something wrapped around it.  The wolf pack with corned beef instead of bacon and swiss cheese was good.  My least favorite part was the hash browns.  I liked that they were crispy on the outside but they must have been a little to thick or something because they were mushy inside.  I would like to go back and try the banana brioche french toast.

This location is definitely a diner you must try out. We came in after the gym for a healthy breakfast, and I was able to find the Avocado Benedict to eat as I'm trying to eat little to no carbs.   I did not put the hollandaise sauce on it and it was freaking amazing. It came with toast as well. You do have the option to add potatoes or tomatoes as a side.  The only thing that I would recommend is that they clean their tables a little bit better and that someone keeps an eye out on the bathroom as it was a little dirty.  I'm not a big breakfast person but if I was to go out to breakfast I would definitely come back for the Avocado Benedict.

Was craving chicken and waffles and saw that they had it on the menu- being that this is so close to home thought we would try it instead of LoLo's. What a mistake! Not sure how you can make waffles that have no taste but they did and the chicken was no better. Our server took our order never came back except to give us the check. Next time I will make the drive.

4 stars for the food and prices.  All of their food looks good and some stuff is pretty unique.  I had their homemade corned beef hash with some eggs and rye toast that never came.  My wife had the Pollo Loco omelet which was good as well.  Good stuff and reasonable prices.  However, if you enjoy the following, Over Easy is probably the place for you.  * a crappy parking situation * a 20 minute wait (which isn't that bad if the place is worth it) * being so crammed in that you are basically sitting on top of the people next to you * being ridiculously hot because they couldn't spring for more/better fans or an outdoor A/C thing (my fault for going in September but tons of people were standing in line to be crammed and hot so I thought I could stick it out) * bad service (god forbid they ask you if everything is ok, if you need anything else, or want a refill on anything but water)  Oh and if my server is reading this, I am still waiting on my toast you said, "would be right out".

I've had pancakes here, which are pretty good - two are more than enough for me.  But - they have the Best traditional breakfast. For few times in a row, I've ordered the bacon, eggs, hash browns and toast breakfast. So far it has been consistent - bacon crisp but not burnt. Scrambled eggs not too runny and not too dry. Hash browns actually edible, crispy but not greasy, yummy along side the eggs.  Toast with your choice of jam. Oh oh - I'm ready for breakfast!  Again.

I came to Over Easy feeling very excited and having very high expectations!  it was suggested by my boyfriend who saw the place being featured on the food network.. Considering that it was a Sunday morning, I didn't mind the 20-25 minute wait.  I figured that it will be all worth it!  For my drink, I was torn between the lemonade with mint and the raspberry lemonade with rosemary so I asked to try both.  I chose the second one but didn't really end up liking it that much.  After a few sips I felt like the flavors didn't really blend too well.  The rosemary was overwhelming.  I took it home and took a while to finish the whole thing.  I drank water during breakfast instead.    I picked the house made corned beef hash which came with 2 eggs and a toasted sourdough.  Corned beef was fresh!! - out of the can!.. the best part of my meal was the egg made over easy!  and the bread was good but Matt's big breakfast sourdough bread is better.  The bf ordered the chicken fried steak which came with a waffle.  He was just equally disappointed..    Service was good and the place was trendy (although tiny).  But other than the hype that was caused by Guy from food network, I don't think this place lives up to it.  Not really worth checking out, I'd rather go to Matt's.
Everything was awesome. Well worth the wait! I loved the chicken fried steak. Coffee was tasty as well. Great kids menu.  Will return again and again.

BACON SAUCE!!!!!   It's mention in the menu peaked my curiosity and honestly tasted good for a couple of bites. But by the end of the brioche I started feeling pretty queezy from the hog fat overload. And I can't help but feel a little out of sorts when I think about Over Easy since. The brioche was also pretty frickin tiny for being on their "entree" menu. Maybe bacon sauce is elsewhere without my knowledge, but it seems like a bizarre and gratuitous invention that should be avoided unless you're are heavily intoxicated.  So why do I still go four stars on this place? Probably the time and care put into everything they bring out to you. The menu is ambitious, so I guess they do have time to concentrate, but there is just something to a perfectly made hearty pancake from the right ingredients.  So  I guess this is where you come for no-nonsense breakfast food made perfectly, but as said before, the prices just don't make a lot of sense when you have to keep ordering things a la carte to work off that hangover. Although maybe not as stupid as their 1130 a.m. closing time, even on weekends when hoards of people are still driving up and trying to get a table at noon.

If I could give them less than 1 star I would. I guess you say the politeness of our server is the reason for the star. Let me start with our reaction could a result of our expectations. With that being said, the final products were almost inedible. My wife and I really thought what was offered on the menu sounded tasty and full of promise. And that MAY be the case, but the execution was as bad as I have ever had. I do not tend to be very tough on my reviews, in fact, I think I'm a little easy to please for the most part. Let's face it, food is supposed to enjoyed and taste good.   My wife ordered the Wolf Pack, a hash brown layered breakfast with the essentials sandwiched between two layers of hash browns. What came out was an over fried pile of mess. The hash browns were so fried that they were not edible. I ordered the chicken fried steak,  a "favored" dish, according to the menu, by Guy Fieri on Drive ins, Diners, and Dive. Well if they served him what the served me, he would have left immediately. The steak was so overly cooked that it took several minutes to simply cut it. Additionally, I received the same over cooked hash browns as my wife with the exception of the 1/3 of the correct portion. Which our server said that more was coming out. When they did come out (20 minutes later), these while being actually edible, were under cooked... How do you under cook potatoes in 20 minutes. More over NOTHING was seasoned properly or at all. The gravey was bland and had a floury taste to it.   When we got there (11am on a Friday), there was literally 3 other tables being served beside us and it took a considerable amount of time (at least 20 minutes) to get our order.  Bottom line our experience was not acceptable. After all the poor execution they over charged me for OJ... We were so disappointed with everything we didn't even ask for anything to be fixed. We simply will not be returning. Come on people, breakfast isn't that hard.
Service was quick and friendly. I had a mimosa, avocado protein toast, and sweet potato tots. One of the best meals I've ever had

This is a great place! They have bright yellow walls with pigs and paintings hanging on them. Good air conditioning. Cow umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and all are for sale!  I had the over easy egg bennie toast, it was an egg over easy on top of fresh spinach with a toast underneath smothered in smooth gravy sauce with bacon slices around it. It was delicious and hit the spot! I even tried my boyfriends Chilequilles and they were SO good!! Just the right amount of cheese, egg, and tortillas with green tomatillo sauce. There was a guy walking around asking every customer if everything was OK and if they had a problem he would quickly resolve it, come to find out it was the owner, he even came to our table and with a big smile asked how everything was. We replied with a big "It's Excellent" as I stuffed food in my mouth. Great staff with excellent customer service, greeted you right away with a smile.

Stumbled upon this place. We sat outside and where overrun at points by flies. The food was decent, although the pairing of avocado and ricotta on the avocado toast takes away from the avocado. Also throwing the chocolate chips on regular pancakes and calling them chocolate chip makes it technically accurate but lazy. The server had a bit of an attitude with serving us coffee and taking orders but he was attentive. We expected just a bit more.

We drove from Avondale to the Arcadia location, waited over 20 minutes and were bumped when a 5 top a waitress knew came in and asked for her. We were fed some line about how they were on the list, left before their name was called and it's policy to seat people that do that ahead of those that were waiting at the restaurant.  The name she pointed to was a party of 4. Customer service is lacking. Every other restaurant i know of, and have worked for, has the policy that if you're not there when your name is called it is crossed off and you go to the end of the line. The food is good but we don't wait an hour to be treated like that.  We ended up leaving without being seated and going to Taylor's.
Hey good go to breakfast place in Gilbert Arizona. They have changed the menu and all looks delicious. Good space to sit down and just relax a cup of joe.
This place is so delicious! $5 mimosas and best French toast I've ever had  real gem!

I have gone here twice and had two very different experiences.  The first time I went was when they first opened. This place allows you to sit where you want and has a very laid back atmosphere. The decor is the mix of industrial with a classic kitchen twist.   The tap water isn't the best so make sure you get a good drink while you are there. the cold brew is a little expensive for the price, the assorted juices were a better choice for us.   The food seems very hit or miss. The first time we went, we had the chicken fried steak, biscuits and reeses pieces pancakes. All of the food was absolute perfection.   The second time we went, we had the eggs Benedict and the ham steak as well as the biscuits. The biscuits this time were very dry and didn't resemble the ones we had on opening weekend. I'm not sure if they changed the recipe or if it's a new cook but I was a little disappointed. The eggs Benedict had a very different sauce than what I've had on eggs Benedict before. It was very bland and also disappointing. Lastly, my fiance had egg shells left in his eggs, which was unpleasant.  I would love to give this place a higher rating but I think the food quality has gone down. I'm hoping that it was just an off day because I did love their food. If you are going to try anything get the chicken fried steak for sure.

Really went in with high hopes for this place. Hadn't ever been and I love a good brunch location.  Went around 1pm this Sunday and was sat next to the hostess stand to have the displeasure of the young, unprofessional hostess nearly the entire time. She made a constant gripe about not wanting to be there, squatting down, even asking us at one point, "Why would you want breakfast at 1pm?" All in all, the hostess made it very clear we were inconveniencing her by coming in to eat.  In addition, our bearded server had to make two attempts to get our drinks and only really came back to give is our checks - which, in his defense there were  two cuties at the bar (that had already been served) that he'd rather give his attention to. My boyfriend's beard wasn't as impressive as his and I skipped out on the heavy makeup - how could we compete, right? All in all, service-wise the place was uncomfortably poor.  Whatever, I still had some hope for the food. Ordered the chilequiles because it's a classic breakfast favorite of mine.  I'll almost always order it if it's on a menu of a place I've never tried before. Basically,  what I got was a plate of cheesy nachos with eggs on top. What the serious F?   The side of hashbrowns I ordered would have been great if I hadn't put their ketchup on it. Why oh why did I stray from the Chollula?! It's clear after opening their ketchup bottles and smelling that they hadn't cleaned them in a long while, if not ever. It smelled rotten and made me queezy knowing I used it on my hashbrowns.   At that point, the whole experience was ruined for me and I was more full of disappointment than their food. A hostess that shouldn't be in the food and bev industry, a server with other things on his mind, breakfast nachos mislead to be called Chilequiles, and ketchup bottles not cleaned since who knows when...no way am I going back.

I love this place... i had something that was the greatest hangover meal ever.... it had bacon, eggs, cheese, and hash browns all mixed together.  they also have fresh squeezed OJ which i always a nice touch for breakie...  though to go with  a large group but solo at the bar is nice... you should check this place out...

OKAY..Ive now been here a few times.. location good.. but, Im not nuts over this place. I have to have poached eggs if Im splurging on breakfast.. sent them back once to have them poached, NOT overdone cooked.. The second time they came back over done, I just sucked it up and dealt with it.. hashbrowns were overdone.. but the coffee was awesome..and the pancakes on my friends plate, looked huge and yummy...IM just not a huge carb girl ! The place is packed pretty much every time I go and Ive waited every time:-) so its popular. AND I just cant sit on a patio in the summer! SO I wait for a indoor table..  Staff.. IDK she didnt seem to be overly concerned with my poached egg issue:-)

This the third time ive been here and they've run out of coffee.      I qould come more often if i could bring a starbucks or something with me.  The swrver was very good however the food comes out for each oerson at different times.   Im done before my granddaughter gets her food  and we all know never feed a kid first.  That way they can complain and be unhappy.  Tried this place 5 times .... never again

This morning I chose the green chili with grits and an egg, it was delicious. My wife had the chicken and waffles which I stole a bite of and it was also delicious. We came around 8 on a Saturday and there weren't many patrons here, by the time We left the place had filled up but it didn't look like more than a 5-10 minute wait time.

At best, all I can say is that I'm not an "Over Easy" fan.  I've been to this location twice and will never go again.  Their service was good; we sat outside in their patio both times.  My first time there was with my wife and she ordered one of their omelets (I don't remember which one) that she thought was not very good.  I had what they called "Chilaquiles" which is a mixture of tortillas, ranchero sauce, chicken, sour cream and cheddar cheese topped with 2 eggs.  This sounded wonderful.  Unfortunately it was simply a couple eggs served over what seemed to be low-grade packaged 'Tortilla Chips'; although I was told they were homemade.  They had melted some cheese and put sauce and sour cream on top of it, but it was (in my opinion) awful.  I ate less than half of it.  I was so sorry I had selected this.    A month later I had a friend that wanted to go there.  I told him my previous experience, but he'd heard great things about this place and was insistent that we go.  I ordered there "House Made Corned Beef Hash" which was so salty I again couldn't finish but half of my order.  My friend looked over their menu (which includes a lot of fancy names for standard items) and asked "Do you have anything like a breakfast burrito?"  The waitress said they did but it was under sandwiches and was called their "Selena."  That's what he ordered.  When our wait person left he asked me "why didn't they simply call it a breakfast burrito rather than attempt to make it sound foo-foo?"  I responded "You're the one that wanted to come here."  I, my wife and my friend will never go back.  This place is definitely for the more sophisticated, higher-class Scottsdale folks.  Not low-lives like me.

Really enjoyed this breakfast spot!  We sat on the patio and took in the view.  The food was really good!  I had a breakfast sandwich called the Dolly.  My friend had the Mediterranean omelet.  We both really enjoyed our food.  My friend commented that the coffee was really good.  The waitress was really attentive and nice.  Great experience all around!  We are so glad we found this spot for breakfast via Yelp!  I want to mention they're only open until noon.

Portion sizes are huggeee.  I left the restaurant so satisfied and jolly.    Service is a bit slow, but it is a pretty popular place. I was lucky enough to get a table for 3 without waiting.  If I had come in 10 minutes later than I did, my namy would have been on the wait list.  Food is great.  Very comforting and everything that you think breakfast should be.  There are a few healthy options that looked great, but I have to still with the hearty, traditional breakfast.    BTW, their tater tots are amazing!!

Wowzers!  Good food but seriously, $5.00 for grapefruit juice and $3.00 for toast to go with your breakfast. Breakfast for two with tip. $48. This included one serving (one not one each) of eggs, bacon, hash browns, coffee, toast, juice and thin pancakes that were not filling. Nothing special. Now Off my list as it costs too much.

Over Easy is a cute space bursting with light and pops of color tucked away in a shopping center plaza. The design of the restaurant is inviting and their various signage playing on the logo format adds a nice cohesiveness.   The menu has a lot of standard breakfast fare mixed with some more unique choices like waffle dogs and eggs benedict with avocado halves replacing the usual English muffin. I personally enjoyed their addition of creamy, fresh ricotta on the avocado toast. I also appreciated their use of local coffee roaster, Press.  The only downside? Having to see Guy Fieri's giant picture in the restaurant and emblazoned on the back of the servers' shirts. I get that a feature on Food Network is a cool accomplishment and a nice marketing point, but seeing his frosted tips first thing in the morning is never enjoyable.

i just returned from Over Easy and I'm a fan.  The man (referred to by other reviewers) who runs the place was very courteous and not only did he help us get seated, he also checked on us during our meal and made a point to say goodbye when we left.  (and it's Sunday Morning)  Food I had their mushroom,cheddar, and scallions Omlette and it was delicious!  They use the 'standard' mushroom and 2 other varieties I couldn't identify *the identification issue is on my part, not theirs :)  The omlette was cooked perfectly and was big enough for 2 people to split.  The Coffee was good for breakfast shop coffee.  Not burned or weak.. I even got a cup to go.  So, to the 2 start haters out there I say: "Lighten up, and enjoy life Over Easy".
Amy is THE best! We come here just to see her. The food is awesome and the energy is great!! And the GM John is always very helpful too.

Our third time here given we are new to the East Valley. Food is very good but service was ridiculously poor today. All service members we encounter didn't listen and out omelet was lukewarm - cheese was almost solid. Many choices as a consumer, will likely not be back for a good long while.
I loved the ice coffee and everything I've ordered here has been fantastic! Is my go to breakfast joint while in this area.

We were really looking forward to going here for a very late breakfast after church.  We got there at 12:45.  The place was pretty empty.  We decided to eat on the patio.  The server seated us. It took awhile for menus.  My husband was just about to get up to find menus when she brought them out after us sitting there almost 10 minutes.  We ordered coffee which she brought out fairly quickly.  Not only was mine cold, but it was weak and old tasting.   I couldn't/didn't even drink it.  My husband ordered the standard Eggs Benedict with extra hollandaise.  He asked to have the grits instead of potatoes.  I ordered the corned beef hash benedict with fruit instead of potatoes.  If another benedict comes with fruit, I find it ridiculous that I would have to pay extra to get the fruit instead of potatoes.  The food came out.  My husband's benedict had absolutely no hollandaise.  Didn't the cook see this before he sent it  out?  So now there is no hollandaise or extra.  The eggs on both benedicts were poached to the hard stage.  The grits were downright nasty.  We were paying extra for them since he didn't want potatoes.  We sent them back.  They were dry, lumpy, just nasty.  My husband is from the south. We eat grits a lot.   Needless to say, as long as we have been wanting to try this place, never, never again. The upside?  Our server was pleasant.
Small portions displayed on small plates to give the illusion of more food.   Not flattered.

I had no complaints about this place.  I thought the food was good and big selection.  Prices were average for this area.  Server was really friendly, which goes a long way with me.  I loved that it wasn't super crowded either.  Some might say that's a bad thing but I loved that about it.  I will definitely go back!

I appreciate when a restauranter ventures to the restaurant waist land of ne mesa to give us a chance to enjoy a better selection of grub. I have been here 4 times now and have experienced a good breakfast with mediocre service to great service and medicore food yester day i had the  wolfpack hashbrowns with 2 eggs and bacon covered with more hashbrowns i requested eggs poached med. they came more to the hard side when one of the employs asked me how my eggs were i said there more to the hard side ,she said   O and walked away  I then asked for a side of holindaise my wait person brought it to me ......cold ....i said can you heat this she of course said no problem .....brought it back an over micro waved sauce that now looked like cottage cheese sent to my table by the (chef???) and delivered by the waitperson  didnt either one of them think lets redo this and not serve a coagulated mess to the customer. i must say the 4 times iv been here theres always been something not quite right from not having change for a $20 to waiting to long for my food  and yesterdays holindaise debacle.

Overall not a good experience on any front.    The food is overpriced.   $6 for a large orange juice is ridiculous and it didn't taste that great.   The quality of the food is not adequate.  The toast was over toasted and burnt.  The fruit looked over-ripe almost to the point of rotting.    When we pointed this out to the waitress, nothing happened.   Overall very disappointing.   There are much better choices in the area.   Stay Away

I came in with my mother in law for a nice brunch on Sunday. This was my first time eating here. We both ordered the avocado eggs Benedict. While the presentation looked nice the food was not so great. The poached eggs were not even warm, the avocado too cold, and the hash browns were cold and stale.  I felt like they sat out all morning or were someone's leftovers. The hollandaise sauce was chunky like blue cheese. Every bite was nauseating. I just didn't enjoy it. Even the water was nasty. Don't think I'll be back. I could have made something better at home.

Came here because we had a local flavor deal.  It was not as good as the Indian School location we previously have frequented.  We ordered the same breakfast burrito as the other location, but this burrito lacked meat and also had way too many peppers and onions. The service was also lacking for a morning where it wasn't full in the restaurant.
I love this place for breakfast. Food is always great and service as well. Definitely a place i go to on a regular basis!

Based on my wife's positive experiences at the other Over Easy locations, we decided to try the Mesa location.  The food is good, we both had omelettes that were prepared well.  The iced coffee is awesome, it's like dessert in a glass.  The reason for my lackluster rating is the state of the men's bathroom.  It was horrible.  The mirror has "gang style" writing scratched into it.  The paper towel dispenser was empty.  The tile floor doesn't look like it had been cleaned for several years.  Worst of all, it smelled terrible.  For a restaurant that has been open for several months, I would think that these issues would have been addressed,  I wish I hadn't used the restroom prior to eating breakfast, it really turned me off.  It makes me wonder how clean the kitchen is?

Wretched. My best friend insisted this place was good for breakfast and so we went... how I regret that decision now. The inside was lovely but it was a deception. The service was bland and disorganized. I ordered chicken fried steak and my husband got the Loretta sandwhich.  The food was not nicely presented and took forever to get.  Then it was cold everywhere else besides but the middle- a sure sign that a microwave was involved.  The sandwhich had tiny peppers and barely any onions- the fries were not fries... I don't know what they were... The coffee and tea were watered down. Service continued to be detached and inattentive. The waiter was supposed to take the corned beef hash off my best friend's bill but didn't, put us all on one check, then divided it wrong! Three of four of us felt ill afterwards. And my friend confessed the more they have gone to this establishment it has gotten slightly worse each time.  My husband and I will not be returning here. Ever.

The food was good and I liked the place, but if you walk out from your meal feeling angry, it's hard to give any more than one star.   We had a Living Social deal. I guess they wish they hadn't sold them because when I got my check there was a "$4.00 service charge". When I asked about it, I was told that they impose what amounts to a 40% tax on the deal "otherwise we don't make any money"  That is not disclosed anywhere so I'm disclosing it here.
