My husband, 1-year old son and I headed to this restaurant because a friend had recommended it.  I had no idea that the original was featured on Food Channel's Diner's, Drive-ins and Dives until after the fact.  The place is attached to the Alltel Ice Den on 93rd Street and Bell Road.  When we 1st walked in, there were 4 employee's working who glanced at us but didn't acknowledge it.  It was until we were fully standing in the middle of the restaurant and made eye-contact with our later-to-be server that she asked us where we wanted to sit.  We decided to sit outside since the weather was perfect.   I ordered the eggs with corn beef hash and toast. My husband ordered the Wolfpack (2 eggs any style, bacon, choice of cheese layered between hash browns).  Our son ate off our plates and had his own bowl of kids tater tots (only $1 and very good!).  I'd have to say I enjoyed my husbands dish more than mine.  The corn beef hash was different than what I was normally used to.  It was basically ground up pieces of corned beef with a few cubes of potatoes and chopped onions mixed in.  The eggs I chose were sunny-side up - and they put a lot of salt on it.  So on top of my salty eggs and corned beef hash that is generally already salty,  I drank 3 glasses of water during my meal.    The service was ok.  Our server didn't refill my water or my husband's ice tea for quite some time.  Other than that, she was friendly to my son (always a bonus)!  Our bill came out to $21 (including a 20% tip).  We'll come back and try this place again.

Appears that lately all of my friends have been on a breakfast kick. Had breakfast for lunch today.  Short walk from the office, so convenient, being noon and in the parking lot of several large office complexes we figured it would be packed but it wasn't. Place is fairly small with an open kitchen concept with a small town diner feel.  Menu is fairly small some classic and unique breakfast dishes with some burgers thrown in the mix.  I opted for the traditional Benedict. Ice tea to drink. Tea tastes herbal, was a refreshing change of pace. Food was prepared quickly.   My Benedict was plated nicely, the only complaint I had was the hollandaise was fairly thin, so thin I could see the perfectly poached eggs beneath.  Almost looked like straight up yolk.  But, everything tasted good. Service was good. Price is on point for the area and portion size was large. My dish easily could be shared with two people with small to normal appetites.  I will go back to Over Easy if I am in the area and have a hankering for breakfast.

I've been a big fan of over easy before the expansion when it was just a small hole in the wall and you waited over 2 hours just for a table. Since then I've visited several locations and have been somewhat satisfied with the food. It's definitely changed over the years and not necessarily for the better. However, this location has now become the absolute slowest of them all. I type this review as I'm going on over an hour wait after ordering my food and am staring at an expediting window with an overflowing printer full of tickets while a man who appears to be a manager rolls silverware and has no regard for the kitchen being so overwhelmed. Plates have been sitting in the window and our server has disappeared for the last 30min .... Probably because of her embarrassment for the longest wait time in breakfast history.

We waited over 45 minutes for our food, and in the duration of the wait we were not checked on for anything. People who walked in way after us got their food at the same time we did. On top of that we were not impressed with the mimosa or the food.

We've driven by the PHX Over Easy many times but I refuse to wait for it.  I knew in my heart that it wasn't the same type of food worth waiting for like Matt's.  We decided to head way out to the apparently non-popular Over Easy to see what all the fuss was about.  To sum it up, just don't bother!  We walked inside and the place was only about 1/2 full so we grabbed a seat in the middle where there were three terribly placed tables.  My first impression was not a good one, as this restaurant is horribly under utilized and very poorly planned.  The color scheme was nice and cheerful though.  I really really hated the vinyl chairs that clung to my legs.  It was really uncomfortable.  After perusing the menu for a few moments I decided that the Wolf Pack was the way to go for me.  I like big manly breakfasts and this sounded perfect!  Two layers of hash browns with bacon and eggs cooked to order in the middle with cheese on top.  Yum!  That really sounded delicious to me, unfortunately it was a big heaping pile of FAIL slopped on a plate.  The bacon was about the only good part of my meal.  The cheese tasted like plastic, the eggs were rubbery, and the hash browns were so greasy that they slicked my lips with oil after every bite.  In the end, despite the fact that I only ate about 1/3 of my food, I got sick.  I was not a happy camper and I will never come back.

Good place for breakfast, order the wolf pack like triple D did. Good service and a nice upgrade move from the old Taco Bell location to the newer current location. We also went to the other location at the ice den which is very modern. One of the better places for breakfast in Phoenix.

Went here because we were in the area and they were open. I love eggs benedict so I ordered the florentine but asked for tomato on it. They offer it with just spinach, the egg, and hollandaise but had no problem adding the tomato. Hubby ordered "The Over Easy - toasted brioche with sautéed spinach, fried egg & natural jus with bacon & scallions." The food was cooked ok but there was no flavor whatsoever to my benedict. I loaded it up with salt and pepper and that made it edible. Served with potatoes so plenty to eat but didn't excite me. Hubby's dish had a lot more flavor but he said it was kinda dry unless you got the egg on each bite. Coupled with the fact that the restaurant was super dirty, including the seats and the floor, I don't think I'd go back. There's plenty of far more exciting places for amazing breakfasts where the food has better flavor and the place is sparkling clean. Certainly not the worst but just mediocre, in my opinion.

I went here with a friend on a Sunday at around 9:00 or 10:00 am since there was only 2 of us we only waited about 10 minutes. I ordered the wolf pack.... It was really good! The service was fast & friendly. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't serve coke products :( but other than that I really enjoyed the experience!

Long line. Short wait (for a table).  Big crack at the bar. The build up the to the featured chicken fried steak was preempted with this lovely site.  We had a laugh.  The food was excellent! All of us really enjoyed our food. Eggs were perfect.  Hash browns were excellent.  Gravy. Awesome.  The CFS was as I expected.    The folks said they'd return. And when I come back to this city, I will return for the green chile pork and grits!!

I've been back a few times, so thought it was time for an update.  Unfortunately, it was worse than I remembered!  I really don't think the food is very good.  I got the mushroom scramble last time. It was disgusting.  I know those are strong words, but that is the way I feel.  The food is way overpriced for what you get.  I would rather put up with the hoards of annoying people at LGO than eat here.

First time at Over Easy even though we only live about a mile away!  Our new go-to breakfast stop.  Great corned beef hash (which I haven't had in years).  Great service.  A little pricey but worth the cost.  Patio was packed.  We'll be back!!

Very good food, service, and diner - like atmosphere and friendly staff. The eggs Benedict was very good, particularly the hollandaise sauce. The Wolfpack breakfast appealed to my husband for its name and taste. The place is clean. It's a bustling place for a sunny breakfast or brunch. Has bar offerings.

I have already been here 2 times.  I like the service, all the employees here are fantastic, very personable and on top of things.  Unfortunately, it's so packed that even if they are on top of things, the service ends up losing quality.   And why is it packed?  Are there no other breakfast places in Gilbert?  Really?!!!  The food sounds great in the menu, but it's just alright.  Nothing to moan about.   So if I go back it'll be on an off-peak time, so at least I can get good service.  And I'll try something else next time, in hopes I can find out what it is that these hoards of people are eating and coming back for more.

One of the few places in town to get a NORMAL breakfast on a weekday!  I used to frequent the place but my office location moved too far away, but when I did, I loved it.  The coffee is great, and the meals are definitely above par.  The current location is a bit noisy for meetings, etc. which is my only gripe.
